bibl.title: Letter from Enrique Cervantes to Philip Showalter Hench, December 20, 1941

div1.p: Cervantes informs Hench that he will be sending him several copies of the last issue of "Medicas." This issue contains a reproduction of the mural "The Conquerors of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from Enrique Cervantes to Philip Showalter Hench, December 20, 1941
div1.opener:
TELEPHONE LEXINGTON 2-7698
MÉDICAS
EDITORIAL AND BUSINESS OFFICES
95 MADISON AVENUE
NEW YORK CITY
December 20, 1941
Dr. P. S. Hench
Department of Internal Medicine
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Doctor Hench:
div1.p:
Under separate cover I am sending you
on behalf of the suggestions made by Dr. Matas, sev-
eral copies of the last issue of Médicas. This issue,
you will note, contains a reproduction of the mural by
Cornwell, “The Conquerors of Yellow Fever, which you
were so largly instrumental in planning. I hope that
the treatment which we gave this reproduction meets
with your satisfaction and approval.
With my best wishes and kindest regards, I am
div1.closer:
Yours very sincerely, Dr. Enrique Cervantes
Editor EC/k
P. S. Kindly address all correspondence to us at:
The Editor
“America Clinica”
Inter-American Division
The New York Academy of Medicine
2 East 103rd Street
New York City
I will be very pleased to received from time to time
reprints of your papers that you might feel will
be of interests to the Latin - America doctors
EC.
